page.title: 03FARMING ON LOWER KNAPP FARM
page.content: Mr. Lea lives on a mixed farm of 250 acres. The farmhouse is 140 years old. His family has lived there since 1912. At present he has 86 dairy cows, 120 beef cows, 105 sows, 5 boars and 30 litters of piglets. He has 3 workers besides himself. The dairy cows are fed on "cake" made of wheat and barley. They also eat silage or graze the pasture in summer. The pigs eat 5 kilogrammes of "cake" a day and drink 3 gallons of water. Each sow has an average of 27 piglets a year in 3 litters. Last year this farm had the best record in the country. The farmers day begins with telephone calls and giving his men their instructions. Then he inspects the animals, helps feed them and scrapes the farmyard.
